Brooklyn Historical Society
Martino family photographs V1997.073
0.01 Linear Feet in one folder
circa 1890s, 1950s Photographs of members of the Martino family, who lived in Brooklyn in the 19th and 20th centuries. Prints by Accession 62
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Martino family photographs, V1997.073, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.
Related Materials
Matson family papers (ARC.320)
Conditions Governing Use
While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Scope and Contents
Collection consists of one photographic portrait of Mary Netterville Martino (circa 1890s), and four photographs of Barbara, Carol, and Esther Martino (1950s). One photograph features a decorated Christmas tree. The Martinos lived in Brooklyn in the 19th and 20th centuries.
Processing Information
Minimally processed to the collection level.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Clarine Matson Webb, 1965.
